005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
009
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.AbstractDataTypeAdapter;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IUuidItem;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
016
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.UUID;
019import java.util.regex.Pattern;
020
021import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
022
023/**
024 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
025 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#uuid">uuid</a>
026 * data type.
027 */
028public class UuidAdapter
029    extends AbstractDataTypeAdapter<UUID, IUuidItem> {
030  @NonNull
031  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
032      List.of(
033          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "uuid")));
034
035  /**
036   * A regular expression that matches a valid UUID.
037   */
038  public static final Pattern UUID_PATTERN
039      = Pattern.compile("^[0-9A-Fa-f]{8}-[0-9A-Fa-f]{4}-[45][0-9A-Fa-f]{3}-[89ABab][0-9A-Fa-f]{3}-[0-9A-Fa-f]{12}$");
040
041  UuidAdapter() {
042    super(UUID.class, IUuidItem.class, IUuidItem::cast);
043  }
044
045  @Override
046  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
047    return NAMES;
048  }
049
050  @Override
051  public JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType() {
052    return JsonFormatTypes.STRING;
053  }
054
055  @SuppressWarnings("null")
056  @Override
057  public UUID parse(String value) {
058    try {
059      return UUID.fromString(value);
060    } catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
061      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
062          String.format("Value '%s' is not a valid UUID.", value),
063          ex);
064    }
065  }
066
067  @Override
068  public UUID copy(Object obj) {
069    // a UUID is immutable
070    return (UUID) obj;
071  }
072
073  @Override
074  public IUuidItem newItem(Object value) {
075    UUID item = toValue(value);
076    return IUuidItem.valueOf(item);
077  }
078}
